sect1.title: git add
sect1.para: git add [modified-file]. This stages the modifications to all the modified-files (including creating the files) to the index. The default if modified-files is not specified is to stage all the modified files in the tree, but not the created ones. The change is not in the local repository until you do a git commit. We'll touch on this more as we continue in the chapter.

This command can be used in a very flexible way by using the -p option. You can select each hunk of the diff that is staged into the index. This allows to test a full change, then divide commits into small atomic pieces that are easier to review and/or understand.
